uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.io
Interface Seekable<P>

All Known Subinterfaces:
SeekableDataSource, SeekableObjectSource<T,P>
All Known Implementing Classes:
CharFileChannel, Chunk, ForwardingSeekableDataSource, ForwardingSeekableObjectSource
public interface Seekable<P>

Interface defining a data-store that can be random-accessed to some extent.

Generally this is combined with an enumeration interface such as ObjectSource to allow positions to re-visited.

Random access is used by some AllPairs implementations so they can record read-offsets at certain times, then return to those offsets later. It allows the All-Pairs implementation to handle arbitrarily large files, within any amount of RAM, at the expense of increased disk I/O.

Author:
Hamish Morgan <hamish.morgan@sussex.ac.uk>

Method Summary
 P position()
          Return the offset of the internal data pointer to the next item that to be read or written.
 void position(P offset)
          Move the internal data pointer to some offset.
 

Method Detail

position

void position(P offset)
              throws IOException

Move the internal data pointer to some offset.

The offset should always be one returned by position(), e because this interface does not define what the value represents. It could be an array index, or it could be byte offset in a file.

Parameters:
offset - location to seek to
Throws:
IOException - something has gone wrong with the underlying store

position

P position()
           throws IOException

Return the offset of the internal data pointer to the next item that to be read or written.

This value can be used by passing it to position(), such that the source will restart from the current position.

Returns:
some current data store offset
Throws:
IOException - something has gone wrong with the underlying store
